title: Problem with opening amazon India website
content: Firefox is preventing from opening https://www.amazon.in/- this has started recently. Initially going to amazon US website and then redirecting from there worked, but not anymore. It keeps showing potential security issue saying "www.amazon.in has a security policy called HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS), which means that Firefox can only connect to it securely. You canâ€™t add an exception to visit this site.". The error code being displayed is SSL_ERROR_BAD_CERT_DOMAIN. However, there is no problem with any other webpage.

title: some youtube videos are not playing
content:
Some videos on Youtube are loading endlessly, I know the problem is with Mozilla because others explorers play the same videos at once, without any problem.

I've already cleaned the cookies and updated Mozilla to the last version as some might recommend it to do, however problem persists. Any idea of what could be the problem?

(I use Pocket tube from a while ago, but I am starting to think it might be that the problem even though this is a recent problem)
creator: pokechristo

title: Site Broken
content: This only affects one of my computers. The website https://www.arkadium.com/free-online-games/ is a site I enjoy playing on. For two of my computers, the site works great. For the one I'm currently on, though, when the video box appears (square black rectangle) it has the wheel of doom going and going for, literally, hours. The other systems sees the video and either plays an ad or not (depending if the site currently has ads available). Either way, after about 20 seconds the video page shows that the games will start is so many seconds. The problem computer does everything but finish and move on. No way to close that screen except to just close it out. I've checked the settings I can find that might apply but changing the settings does nothing new. I hope this isn't confusing. It's been a long day. I'd just like to play those games with this laptop. The attached screen shot is what I see after trying to open the site.
creator: haiweepp1

title: History sidebar
content: I updated my OS to Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS and now when I open Firefox (Version 104.0) my history comes up automatically as a sidebar. I don't want this to happen, how can I make it stop?
creator: fftandy

title: Lost bookmarks
content:
Started my computer this morning and tried to use Firefox and it froze. So bad that I had to restart my computer. I re-installed Firefox but it deleted my bookmarks. What do I have to do to get them back? Fortunately I did a backup on my computer before re-installing Firefox. Is there some other way to get them back other than to restore the backup? Any help will be greatly appreciated. I just wish I wasn't such a Luddite when it comes to computers.

Eric Nerenberg [email and phone# removed from public]
creator: webneck

title: McAfee Blocked Site and Suspicious Activity by an app
content:
McAfee has notified me that a piece of software which is apparently from HP (HPUpdate within HP Framework) is trying to access a suspicious IP address (13.224.2.51).

An online search doesn't show this as being associated with HP but it is in an Amazon centre so it could be associated with almost anyone.

Is there anything in the Mozilla world which would help me determine whether this is a genuine problem or McAfee is just confused?

At this point my option seems to be to reinstall the my HP printer software and see what impact this has.
creator: gcrobinson

title: Auto Login issue
content: Hi, My browser started slowing down so I did the reset as suggested. Unfortunately, this changed the login settings and now when I go to my Gmail, Minds, mewe or other accounts is auto signs me in. I have gone into to settings and unchecked the auto fill and Ask to save logins and passwords for websites. That did nothing. I do not want any pages to auto login but I would like to be able to select a user name an password when I go to enter a webpage that requires one. Having the Auto login is a hug security issue for me. Can you please help.
creator: m.george6162

title: a web site closes as soon as I open it
content:
I have 2 computers running Firefox, both running 104.0. This computer is windows 11 other windows 10.

Problem; Up until about a week ago I was able to click email links to open judicialwatch.org on this Win11 computer. Now, whenever I try to open that site (via link or direct entry) the tab closes immediately. From a link, I can see the tab open then close, from direct input it just closes when I hit enter. (The windows 10 computer has no problem.) I have searched for any settings that would show blocked web sites and cannot find any settings / listing of blocked web site. As the win11 is my primary computer, this is VERY annoying. Any help will be greatly appreciated. Thanks, Scott
creator: sbhepburn

title: Cannot drag the scroll slider with touch screen after updating to 104.0
content:
I am using Windows 10. The Firefox on my laptop is just updated to 104.0 and I realised that I can no longer drag the slider of the scrollbar on a webpage with the touch screen of my laptop. I can still drag the sliders of the History sidebar and bookmark library though. Is this change intended? Or is my Firefox profile just messed up after the update?

Thank you.
creator: beterc
